doc.after: Positioned asymmetrically around the South Pole and largely south of the Antarctic Circle, Antarctica is the southernmost continent and is surrounded by the Southern Ocean; alternatively, it may be considered to be surrounded by the southern Pacific, Atlantic, and Indian Oceans, or by the southern waters of the World Ocean. It covers more than 14,000,000Â km2 (5,400,000Â sqÂ mi),[1] making it the fifth-largest continent, about 1.3 times as large as Europe.
